questionnaire.question: The interactive application was easy to navigate.
The content of the interactive application was clear and understandable.
The interactive application effectively demonstrated the principles of simple logic circuits.
The interactive application increased my understanding of simple logic circuits.

notes: Clear feedback on user actions.
Instantaneous response to user input.
Visible loading indicators during data retrieval.
Easy reversal of actions with 'undo' or 'back' options.
Clear prompts for irreversible actions.
Ability to exit or cancel processes at any point.
Visible and easily accessible options.
Contextual cues to guide users through tasks.
Minimisation of reliance on user memory.

nielsen.heuristic: Match Between System and the Real World
notes: Consistent language and icons with real-world equivalents.
Actions and options reflect user expectations.
Familiar terminology for menu items and functions.
Clean and uncluttered interface.
Prioritisation of essential information.
Minimal distractions to focus user attention.
Elements within a defined boundary are perceived as belonging together.
Borders or visual separators indicate shared context or purpose.
Objects near each other are perceived as related or belonging to the same group.
Spatial proximity implies contextual connection.
Users interpret complex visuals in the simplest way possible to minimize cognitive effort.
Ambiguous visuals are interpreted as basic shapes or forms.
Simplification reduces cognitive load for users.
Similar elements in design are perceived as belonging together.
Similarity implies shared characteristics or function.
Elements visually connected are seen as more related than those with no connection.
Users see elements with visual connections as more closely related.

consent.text: I consent to the collection of my feedback for research purposes.
I understand that my participation is voluntary and that I can withdraw at any time without giving a reason.
I agree that the data collected will be used for academic purposes and may be published in an anonymous form.
